official-title.#text: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit certain nurse practitioners, clinical nurse specialists, physician assistants, and certified nurse-midwives to provide certain certifications with respect to inpatient hospital services under the Medicare program.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Protect Patient Access and Promote Hospital Efficiency Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protect Patient Access and Promote Hospital Efficiency Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Permitting certain nurse practitioners, clinical nurse specialists, physician assistants, and certified nurse-midwives to provide certain certifications with respect to inpatient hospital services under the Medicare program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), or a certified nurse-midwife (as such term is defined in
) who is privileged and credentialed at the hospital at which such services are to be furnished, the nurse practitioner, clinical nurse specialist, physician assistant, or certified nurse-midwife)

quote.#text: (or, in the case of such inpatient hospital services ordered by a nurse practitioner, clinical nurse specialist, physician assistant (as such terms are defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1814(a)(3) of the Social Security Act

text.#text: Nothing in this section, including the amendment made by this section, shall be construed as, or have the effect of, changing any State scope of practice law for any health care professional.

header.#text: No effect on State scope of practice law
